comments.body: Many phones don't have external SD card slots anymore. On those phones we are not able to backup or move our worlds to other devices because they are not findable. Please advise are create an easier way to backup or share worlds.
I really need this! My build was stuck in the Application and I can't share my map with my friends. Pls add this function

Just wanted to move a world from an old device to a new device. Either offer to switch from application to internal or some type of backup via email or to a device location would be nice so that you do not loose your world.

Before updating to Cliffs and Caves, I was able to connect my Andriod phone to my PC and then browse into my phone and copy Games -> mojang.com from my phone to my PC, thereby backing up my whole Minecraft file structure.  After I upgraded, I guess the files are stored somewhere else as Games -> mojang.com is my old saved world and I cannot find the files anywhere else on my phone via Windows Explorer.

Where did they go?  I've been working on my world for years and would hate to lose it should something become corrupt.

It's such an obvious thing to have your worlds synced to your Microsoft account(OneDrive)so you can play it in all your devices or easily reset your phone without losing your world, i don't know why this option doesn't exist.
you can do that with this command each tick: /execute store result bossbar <bossbar name> value run data get entity <boss selector> Health
I do this with my Lenovo computer!

It is also annoying for builders and survival players too, when you're going to close the interface, it's like those annoying pop-up ads that takes time to load and you can't close it until it loaded.

Let us have the option to disable that button
YES, give us an option in the settings menu to disable how to play buttons instead of having to resort to texture packs

I agree, but I think I should elaborate on why this is important.

Minecraft is a fantastic resource for language learning, since it gives you a ton of exposure to vocabulary. However Japanese is a very difficult language to learn, partially because of its three writing systems: hiragana, katakana, and kanji. Hiragana and katakana are not very difficult because each character stands for a specific sound. Kanji are the issue because instead of standing for a specific sound they stand for a specific meaning, so you have a kanji for water, fire, axe, decision, etc. Because of this a single kanji can have multiple readings, kind of like how the character 2 is read differently than the same character in the word 2nd. Unless you know the word or kanji, you don't know how to pronounce it/read it.

For example, if I wanted to learn the word for axe (斧, read おの), you'd have to pick up a dictionary or kanji lookup tool instead of just reading the name. Looking up kanji takes time, which takes you out of the game.

Furigana is a way of solving this problem. Basically, furigana places the hiragana reading of a kanji above the kanji itself. This allows people who don't know the kanji to read it correctly. Now instead of having to look up the reading, the reading is right there.

By adding furigana, you'd be making the game more accessible to language learners and young Japanese people by making the game easier to read.

The way Mojang and Microsoft are trying to implement this is not going well. They implemented it by default with their own set of unacceptable words and did not allow the player to turn it on and off. Minecraft is not just a game for kids. For instance, if players are on a medieval roleplay server, but they cannot say the word "Knight" because it contains 3 unacceptable letters, this greatly damages the quality of the game. Ultimately, having this enabled by default restricts every community of minecrafters, and will kill the game's popularity. Microsoft is getting to be too heavy handed with their game, as they have with other games, which will lead to suffering sales and returning users, smothering the once vibrant and vital flame of the community, leaving only a wisp of smoke as the last few users simply put up with the changes and allow themselves to be controlled.

I think this is a better chat filter than the one Mojang has put in place in 1.19.2, and would be a great thing to implement in the game instead, and while online play would be prohibited, it would only be prohibited to how the parents/guardians feel needed, or any adult who doesn't want to hear every swear word when they beat a toxic player hypixel.

I completely agree because I moved over to bedrock windows 10 from java edition and the most frustrating thing was having a massive recipe window take up my screen and having to manually click off from it. Also upon opening my inventory again, sometimes it comes back even though I toggled it off. I've played Minecraft for a very long time and I don't need help remembering recipes. And as for beginners, it doesn't seem too difficult to just toggle on the recipe book when they need to see the recipes. For these reasons I suggest that this simple feature be added into the game. This suggestion deserves more attention!

I want to preface this with the fact that I'm an OLD, white, straight, male, who doesn't really "get" all this gender-importance business that is currently a "hot topic" -- The reason I say this is to make my next statement all the more important:
This is a !!GREAT!! idea. Not only for the reasons you listed but so many more! 
I used to work security for the government, for example, and A LOT of kids play minecraft. It would be great for them (or their parents) to be able to set a basic, nondescript, type of skin so that if they play online they don't feel the need to talk about, or discuss their gender, or be mis-cast. For example: A young girl who is either fully feminine/female, or too young to know/care about such things often has the choice of either; Picking the girl skin, because she is a girl, and does NOT want to walk around with a boy skin, but then has to constantly hear stuff about her being a girl, or Pick the boy skin. And just pretend to be a boy.

(This is but one of several examples that instantly came to mind when I read your suggestion, I decided to list it specifically because of it's security and children safety issues. But there are so many more! Good job. ~upvoted~)
I really like the idea of having a genderless skin. I'm tired of Alex taking all the attention, and This would be an easy solution.

I agree that we need a griefing menu or at least have it toggle for each mob type that it pertains to. I would like to have griefing turned off except for passive mobs like villagers and sheep. Villagers need griefing on so they can actually harvest and replant their crops, plus they never break blocks, just crops. Sheep just affect the state of grass on blocks. That is not a big deal typically. You've got my vote.
Wither griefing off would make wither rose farms actually possible to be fully idiot-proof in the overworld without bedrock.

If a "Griefing Menu" was added, I feel it being delimited by mob type would be the easiest option.

(Y/N) Mob Griefing

  • (Y/N) Passive
  • (Y/N) Neutral
  • (Y/N) Hostile

Personally, I dislike creeper holes; they are an inconvenience. But I absolutely despise Enderman burglaries. My personal default setting would therefore be Y,N,Y.

  • (Y) Villagers could still operate as vanilla. Sheep still work the same either way. When eating grass, they just don't change the block state when griefing is off.
  • (N) No Enderman thefts.
  • (Y) Creeper holes still occur and the end dragon could still break blocks.

IMHO, this is a quality of life preference. If I place a block somewhere, I expect it to stay there and not go wandering off in the middle of the night. If a creeper blows up beside me, and I am not paying attention, this is player interaction, blocks around me are now items.
I vote just taking the mobGriefing rule and splitting it into two:  a "good" mob griefing (e.g. villagers farming, sheep eating) and "bad" mob griefing (creeper effects, endermen, etc.)

They made it that way so that you don't accidentally toggle it. Imagine if you were in a ledge crouching and you accidentally touched the crouch button (because it's so close to the dpad). On the current version, nothing would happen. With instant shift, however, you'd falling for your death. Even if they added it as an option I doubt anyone would use it after the first mishap

PCScreen ik when i wanna click my shift button and i use a texture pack that makes my buttons invis and i can still click it when i want to. Id be much easier for me to do fun things with shifting like shift at my friends faster and punch em and itd be alot easier for me personally to shift.

This is a really good idea. It would be great if instead of holding down the crouch button, that there's a option to remove the two tap delay. This would improve combat in mobile allowing players to not be stuck behind the shield when in combat.
Example: a skeleton fire an arrow. Because of the delay tap, the player depending on the distance would be struck by the arrow or be able to block it. The closer they are to the skeleton the less time they have to block. They would need to be extremely quick at tapping to block that arrow. With the option to hold instead, they would only need to press it down once, they be free to attack afterwards without the mobility plenty of having the shield up (again because of the two pat delay.)
Minecraft kept the option to allow players to switch the crouch with the jump to the old controls. This I find to be great for strafing.
If holding the crouch is going to be a problem. They always can have it so if you tap twice, it would remain the same automatic hold down crouch, but when you need to block at least, you can hold down the button.
This movement that can allow someone in PVP or PVE on mobile to be close enough in to compete with someone on console or PC.
Also I would like a old feature back which is pointless allowing mobile players to swing their fist, tools and weapon around. The pc and console player can do it, why not mobile?
